discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We observe "},{"type":"text","text":"Kishlaya's Identity","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" closely and make use of the MacLaurin Expansion of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\log(1-x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum_{n=1}^\infty \sum_{m=1}^\infty \frac{x^n}{m{n+m \choose m}} = -\log(1-x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow \sum_{n=1}^\infty x^n \left(\sum_{m=1}^\infty \frac{1}{m{n+m \choose m}}\right) = \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{x^k}{k}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
On comparing the coefficients, we can conclude the following
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum_{m=1}^\infty \frac{1}{m{n+m \choose m}} = \frac{1}{n}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow \sum_{m=1}^\infty \frac{(m-1)!}{(n+m)!} = \frac{1}{n.n!}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow \sum_{m=1}^\infty \left(\prod_{k=0}^n \frac{1}{m+k}\right) = \frac{1}{n.n!}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
And thus, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(n) = \frac{1}{n.n!}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(I'll leave it as an exercise for the reader to compute "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(n)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by other method(s).)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, we compute "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Q(n)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Q(n) = \sum_{k=1}^n \frac{1}{P(k)} = \sum_{k=1}^n k.k!"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
We can telescope the above sum as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow k.k! = ((k+1)-1).k! = (k+1)!-k!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow Q(n) = \sum_{k=1}^n \frac{1}{P(k)} = \sum_{k=1}^n (k+1)!-k! = 2!-1!+3!-2!+\ldots+(n+1)!-n!"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
And thus,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow Q(n) = (n+1)!-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Therefore, we are just left with computing
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Q(2015)+2015 \pmod{10000} = 2016! + 2014 \pmod{10000} = \boxed{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            No, by taking "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{\pmod{10000}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", I mean exactly the same i.e. the last four digits. It doesn't makes any difference.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I used Jon Haussman method to solve , enjoyed this question , we are able to see this-"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(n) = \sum_{m=1}^\infty \left(\prod_{k=0}^n \frac{1}{m+k}\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" P(n) = \sum_{m=1}^\infty \dfrac{1}{m\times(m + 1) \times(m+2)\cdots(m+n)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" P(n) =  \sum_{m=1}^\infty \dfrac{(m-1)!}{(m+n)!}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" P(n) = \dfrac{1}{n.n!} \sum_{m=1}^\infty \dfrac{(m-1)!n!(m+n - m)}{(m+n)!}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" P(n) = \dfrac{1}{n.n!}  \sum_{m=1}^\infty \dfrac{(m - 1)!n!}{(m+n-1)!} - \dfrac{m!n!}{(m+n)!}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" P(n) = \dfrac{1}{n.n!}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"[Q(n) = n.n!]"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" Q(n) = (n + 1 - 1)n! \implies (n+1)! - n!"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" Q(2015)  + 2015 = 2016! - 1 + 2015 = 2016! + 2014"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I think it was not necessary to take mod , we can directly say 2016! will have many zeros so the last four digits of it will be 0000 and adding 2014 we get the last four digits as 2014.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The above series simplifies to"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac {1}{1.2.3.....(n+1)}+\frac{1}{2.3.4.5.......(n+2)}....."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"multiply and divide by n."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac {1}{n} (\frac {n+1-1}{1.2.3....(n+1)}+\frac{n+2-2}{2.3.4......(n+2)}...)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"this is a telescopic series and thus we get "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"[P(n)=\frac {1}{n.n!}]"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"After that the next part is easy."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(n)=\sum\limits_{m=1}^{\infty}\left(\prod\limits_{k=0}^{n}\frac{1}{m+k}\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\qquad\;\,=\sum\limits_{m=1}^{\infty}\frac{1}{n}\left(\prod\limits_{k=0}^{n-1}\frac{1}{m+k}-\prod\limits_{k=1}^{n}\frac{1}{m+k}\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\qquad\;\,=\frac{1}{n}\prod\limits_{k=0}^{n-1}\frac{1}{1+k}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\qquad\;\,=\frac{1}{n\cdot n!}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Q(n)=\sum\limits_{k=1}^{n}k\cdot k!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\qquad\;\,=\sum\limits_{k=1}^{n}\left((k+1)!-k!\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\qquad\;\,=(n+1)!-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Q(2015)+2015=2016!+2014"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2016!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has more than four trailing zeroes, the answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1/ P (n) = {1, 4, 18, 96, 600, 4320, 35280, ... , 2311256907767808000, 48658040163532800000, 1072909785605898240000, ...} Sequence can be formulated for finding all terms; "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r = n + 1/ n + 2; 1/ P (n) = (n)(n!)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Q (n) = {1, 5, 23, 119, 719, 5039, 40319, ..., 121645100408831999, ...}"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"[Q (2015)] = [Q (21)] = 9999"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9999 + 2015 = 12014"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"[12014] = 2014"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\large \\sum_{d|2016} \\mu(d)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\mu"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" denotes the "},{"type":"text","text":"Möbius function","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" and the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are the positive divisors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2016."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can apply a fundamental result of the "},{"type":"text","text":"mobius function","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":". Specifically, if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n > 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum_{d|n} \mu(d) = \boxed{0}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The proof is as follows.  Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" n = p_1^{\alpha_1} \cdot p_2^{\alpha_2} \cdot \ldots \cdot p_r^{\alpha_r}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ("},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha_i \ge 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for all i =1,...,r). If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" d|n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" d =  p_1^{\beta_1} \cdot p_2^{\beta_2} \cdot \ldots \cdot p_r^{\beta_r}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0 \leq \beta_i \leq \alpha_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for i = 1,...,r.  If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta_i \ge 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for some i = 1, ... , r , then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\mu(d) = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Therefore,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large \sum_{d|n} \mu(d) = \sum_{(\beta_1, \ldots , \beta_r)/ \beta_i = 0 \quad \text{or} \quad 1} \mu(p_1^{\beta_1} \cdot \ldots \cdot p_r^{\beta_r})  = "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large = 1 - \binom{r}{1} + \binom{r}{2} - \ldots + (-1)^{r} \binom {r}{r} = (1 - 1)^{r} = 0."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here's another proof that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle\sum_{d \mid n} \mu(d) = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n > 1."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that sums of arithmetic functions on divisors are multiplicative. Therefore, if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" n = p_{1}^{a_{1}} p_{2}^{a_{2}} \cdots p_{k}^{a_{k}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we know that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \displaystyle\sum_{d \mid n} = \displaystyle\sum_{d_{1} \mid p_{1}^{a_{1}}} \mu(d_{1})  \cdots \cdot \displaystyle\sum_{d_{k} \mid p_{k}^{a_{k}}} \mu(d_{k}). "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" However, note that any term of the product is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 0 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", since all terms "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\mu(p^2)= 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \mu(1) + \mu(p) = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so we are done."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2016 01 Level 1 or 2?

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/oYLpPevie7-untitled.png?width=1200"}},{"type":"text","text":"
Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the distance traveled by bus before the man board on it.Let "},{"type":"text","text":"t","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" be the time taken for it."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Displacement of man"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= 48+x=10t"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"           ------"},{"type":"text","text":"(1)","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Displacement of bus"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = x= \frac { 1 }{ 2 } \times 1\times { t }^{ 2 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"         -------"},{"type":"text","text":"(2)","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using "},{"type":"text","text":"(1)","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"text","text":"(2)","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":","}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t=8s","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"text","text":"t=12s","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There are two time instances because at first the man can overtakes the bus as his velocity is more initially.He could board the bus without overtaking.This corresponds to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ 8 }^{ th }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" second. Then the bus accelerates and its can overtake the man.The man could also board the bus at this instance also. This corresponds to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ 12 }^{ th }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" second."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
